Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-DI3 (Dermaseptin-DI3, DRS-DI3, dermadistinctin M, DDM; DD M; UCLL1; Ala-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: the Brazilian frog,Phyllomedusa distincta, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E-faecalis (MIC >38 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 38 uM), E. coli (MIC 9.7 uM), S. aureus (MIC 38 uM).Toxicity: Hemolysis >33 uM. Also provided by Erik Martin. Updated 6/2015; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Batista CV, da Silva LR, Sebben A, Scaloni A, Ferrara L, Paiva GR, Olamendi-Portugal T, Possani LD, Bloch C Jr1999
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the Brazilian frog Phyllomedusa distincta.
